data.title: When Worlds Collide by Wylie Balmer, First Edition
data.meta_description: WHEN WORLDS COLLIDE (Dell Books # 627) by Wylie, Philip. & Balmer, Edwin and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. 7.5 x 5", blue-lettered red cloth, 344pp, covers quite rubbed with some white spots, extremities bumped and fraying, pp toned with some spotting and finger soiling, pp has an inkstamp from "Story's End Book Shop, 4140 NE Sandy"; an okay copy of the FIRST EDITION (NAP) in a worn, spine-faded, soiled, stained and edge worn "Triangle Books" dustjacket. Made into a popular science fiction movie in 1951. Cast included Frank Cady (later Sam Drucker on "Petticoat Junction") and Hayden Rorke (who portrayed Colonel Bellows on "I Dream Of Jeannie"). Costume design by Edith Head!.

Hard Cover. Condition: Very Good. Fisrt Edition, first Printing. VERY GOOD; FIRST EDITION, first printing with black staining on top edge; the pages are clean and unmarked and the binding is getting a bit soft but still in very good condition; the covers have edgewear and a 2 inch scrape on the front cover but otherwise they are in very good condition; no dust jacket; 8vo - over 7¾" - 9¾" tall Size: 8vo - over 7¾" - 9¾" tall.

First Edition. WHEN WORLDS COLLIDE, Stokes, 1933, first edition, slight wear to the spine extremities and 3 of the 4 fore edge corner tips, some light dust-soiling to the covers, else a vg copy. Of 3 binding states, this one has powder blue lettering on both the burgundy cloth spine and front cover. The source book for the 1951 film of the same name.

First edition in book form, first printing. Publisher's original red cloth, with light blue titles to the upper board and spine, lacking the scarce dustwrapper. A good or slightly better copy, the binding firm with some bumping and a little fraying to the tips of the slightly faded spine. The contents, with the name of ['Obelists' crime writer] C. Daly King in blue ink on the front endpaper (in capitals rather than his signature so difficult to say in whose hand the name is written), a light water stain to the lower corner of approximately 100 pages towards the rear and the occasional mark to a couple of page margins, are otherwise clean and without loss or tears. First published in six monthly parts between September 1932 and February 1933 in 'Blue Book' magazine. A novel of world destruction by an invading planet and the flight of a few survivors to a new world. The basis for the 1951 Academy Award winning film of the same name directed by Rudolph Maté. (Bleiler; Locke: A Spectrum of Fantasy). Further details and images for any of the items listed are available on request. Lucius Books welcomes direct contact with our customers.

Hard Cover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Good+. First Edition. Grey boards with dark blue print. 344/341pp. Second printing indicated on the top edge of the front flap. Name writing in pen to the inside of the front cover. Initials in ink on the title page. Small symbols written on the top inside corner of the rear cover in pen. Light shelf lean. The binding is just slightly loose. The text block has faint toning to the outside edges. The top end of the spine has been gently nudged. Light soiling to the top edge of the cover and spine. The jacket is unclipped and has had a protective poly cover added. The jacket has light rubbing and creasing to all folding edges. The jacket has chipping to the outside corners. The top rear corner of the spine on the jacket has a 1-inch open tear and the remaining corners each have ½-inch open tears. The pages are bright and clean. Used Book.

First Edition. WHEN WORLDS COLLIDE, Stokes, 1933, 1st edition, a bright near fine copy of this classic world catastrophe novel in an equally bright vg+ first printing full color pictorial dust-wrapper with a small chip missing from the upper left corner of the bit faded dust-wrapper spine panel. Of three binding states, this is by far the scarcest and while we cannot prove it to be the first of the three such bindings, the logical evidence certainly seems to support this case as this binding has gold lettering on the spine only and measures an 1/8 inch higher than its other two counterparts; both shorter and identical in size, one with powder blue lettering on both the burgundy cloth spine and front cover and the other with black lettering on both the brick red cloth spine and front cover. While the priority of these bindings may remain unknown, it certainly was a long time custom for first state bindings to have gold-gilt lettering and later state bindings to be without. Also it seems most illogical for a contemporary later issue binding to be larger than its companions. Thus we argue and thus we rest, perhaps forever without certainty. The source book for 1953 film of the same name.

Octavo, pp. [i-vi] vii-viii 1-344, original red cloth, front panel stamped in light blue and ruled in blind, spine panel stamped in light blue, fore and bottom edges rough trimmed. First edition. A famous, popular catastrophe novel that was a huge commercial success (over half a million copies sold) and was made into a film that helped spark the SF movie boom of the 1950s. Anatomy of Wonder (1976) 3-3; (1981) 2-130; (1987) 2-146; (1995) 2-156; and (2004) II-70. Bailey, Pilgrims Through Space and Time, pp. 125-26. Clareson, Science Fiction in America, 1870s-1930s 042. Clarke, Tale of the Future (1978), p. 62. Clute and Nicholls (eds), The Encyclopedia of Science Fiction (1993), p. 86. Locke, A Spectrum of Fantasy, p. 27. Survey of Science Fiction Literature V, pp. 2463-68. In 333. Bleiler (1978), p. 14. Reginald 00801. A fine copy in fine four-color pictorial dust jacket. This is the correct first printing jacket with ad for FLAWED BLADES by P. C. Wren on rear flap and printed price $2.00 at upper right corner of front flap. A lovely, like new copy. Rare in this condition. (#154903).
